results.title: Puss in boots
results.brief_description: One of Lotte Reiniger’s early silhouette films, recreating the well-known fairytale in black and white cut-outs manipulated on a glass-topped table. Production: Carl Koch, Louis Hagen, Vivian Milroy. Design and animation: Lotte Reiniger. Music: Freddie Phillips.

results.title: Push
results.brief_description: This engaging work explores the narrative device of ‘what if?’ to create a quirky and fun filled piece demonstrating sophisticated control of compositing in a playful exploration of the possibilities of technology.

results.title: Push
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman, Wombat Productions, Inc. and Urs Furrer
results.brief_description: The extraordinary dependence on the push-button is the subject of this unnarrated view of American society. Focuses on the familiar push-buttons found in everyday life, showing that while some technological advances are destructive, others are vitally needed.

results.title: Purse Seining: a new Australian fishery
results.brief_description: The film refers to and shows some of the aerial and sea surveys of the pelagic fish resources off the Australian Coast, undertaken bby the Divsion of Fisheries, CSIRO. Describes in detail the use of the purse-seine net in catching mackerel off the Tasmanian coast.

results.title: Purposes of family planning
results.creator_credit: John Churchill, Moreland-Latchford Productions and H Lemieux
results.brief_description: The film is designed to present simply and in easy-to-understand laymen’s language, the different reasons why people choose to practise family planning. Appealing to audiences in a broad range of age levels and economic circumstances, it combines dramatization with voice-over narration to show real people in different situations as they learn about planning a family. Among the motivations for choosing to practise family planning shown in this film are health, emotional maturity, economic stability, and the need to provide each child with individual love and attention. It provides invaluable information about the positive aspects of family planning, giving the viewer an opportunity to learn, discuss and to arrive at very carefully considered decisions.

results.title: Purple silken mist = Kabut sutra ungu
results.creator_credit: Matari Artis Jaya Film, Dharma Effendy, M Sukmadjaya and Sjuman Djaya
results.brief_description: Russian-trained director Sjuman Djaya depicts a story of the social stigma faced by a young widow in middle-class Jakarta. Jenny Rachman plays the pretty wife who is left widowed when her pilot husband dies suddenly. After being taunted by several other men she takes a liking to Dimas, her late husband’s younger brother, who bears a striking resemblance to him. Dimas starts to replace his brother as the young children mistake him for their dead father. The children’s mother however resists Dimas’ marriage proposal for fear that it is not true love that has brought them together. Winner of 4 Citra Awards at the 1990 FFI. Cast includes Jenny Rachman, Roy Marten and Joice Erna. In Indonesion with English subtitles that are sometimes difficult to read.

results.title: Purple rain
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Robert Cavallo, Steven Fargnoli, Joseph Ruffalo and Albert Magnoli
results.brief_description: Long before he was the Artist Formally Known As…, Prince’s debut feature is a thinly disguised semi-autobiographical account of the rise of a Minneapolis musician called the Kid. ‘Purple Rain’s‘ threadbare plot mines familiar territory as it recounts The Kids struggle to break away from his destructive family and come into his own musically with his special brand of electronic rock. Throw in the obligatory romance with an aspiring singer (Apollonia Kotero) and a long standing feud with a rival band (Morris Day and The Time), and that pretty much sums it up. Where the film shines however is in its great concert sequences and the brilliant music score (Prince won an Oscar for his efforts) performed and provided by Prince and his band The Revolution. Cast also includes Morris Day, Olga Karlatos, Clarence Williams the third, Wendy Melvoin, Lisa Coleman, Bobby Z, Matt Fink, Brown Mark and Jerome Benton. (Awards: 1985 Academy Award- Best Music, original Score Song- Prince)

results.title: Purple haze
results.creator_credit: Ian Stevenson, Rachael Hynes, Katherine Hynes and Bondi Beech
results.brief_description: This documentary follows the story of 5 Jacaranda Queen candidates in the country town of Grafton, NSW, before and after the crowning. It examines all the trials and tribulations of preparing for the ceremony and coping with not only losing, but winning. Their candid experience is reflected against the background of Grafton, a town living through tough economic times, the community expectation of the events, and the impact or relevance it has on their lives. Produced with assistance from the Australian Film Finance Corporation.

results.title: Puritan family of early New England
results.brief_description: A class-room film, describing the daily activities of a Puritan family living in a New England coastal village. Shows the father hunting and dressing skins, the mother making soap, candles and cornbread, and the children spinning, digging clams, and doing school work. Explains the importance of religion in daily life and the dependence of the early settlers upon each other.

results.title: Pure steam: The Flying Scotsman in Australia (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jim Revitt, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Peter Henshaw
results.brief_description: For almost a year the world’s most famous working steam locomotive, The Flying Scotsman 4472, from Britain, thrilled Australian steam enthusiasts from coast to coast. During 1988/89 4472 visited five Australian states and the Northern Territory. Its spectacular parallel runs, double-heading and solo trips have been brilliantly recorded by camera crews from ABC TV, from the air, trackside and on board.
